STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ROBERT GORDON
GOVERNOR DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING DIRECTOR
LANSING
September 4, 2020
Aprille Sutton
Child & Family Services of Northwestern Michigan
3785 Veterans Drive
Traverse City, MI 49684
RE: License #: CB280201037
Investigation #: 2020C0114028
Child & Family Services of Northwestern Michigan
Dear Ms. Sutton,
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
611 W. OTTAWA  P.O. BOX 30664  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Courtney Atkins, Area Manager, at 517-599-3667.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 383-5531
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB280201037
Investigation #: 2020C0114028
Complaint Receipt Date: 06/02/2020
Investigation Initiation Date: 06/03/2020
Report Due Date: 08/01/2020

Licensee Address: 3785 Veterans Drive
Traverse City, MI 49684
Licensee Telephone #: (231) 946-8975
Administrator: Aprille Sutton, Designee
Licensee Designee: Gina Aranki, Designee
Name of Facility: Child & Family Services of Northwestern Michigan
Facility Address: 3785 Veterans Drive
Traverse City, MI 49684
Facility Telephone #: (231) 946-8975
Original Issuance Date: 09/01/1990
License Status: REGULAR

Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
1

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
It is alleged that the agency failed to report to Central Intake Yes
suspected physical abuse of a foster child by the bio-father and
stepmother.
Additional Findings No
III. METHODOLOGY
06/02/2020 Special Investigation Intake
2020C0114028
06/03/2020 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
06/04/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
PC w/ DHHS Supervisor
06/09/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
PC to CPS Worker
06/14/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
Interview CPS Worker
06/17/2020 Contact - Document Received
08/12/2020 Contact - Face to Face
Interview Chief Administrator
08/12/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
08/12/2020 Contact - Document Received
Document from CA
2

08/13/2020 Contact - Face to Face
Interview Foster Care Worker
08/14/2020 Contact - Face to Face
Interview FC Supervisor
08/24/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
Interview Bio Parent/Step Parent
08/25/2020 Contact - Telephone call made
Interview Relative
08/25/2020 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
08/25/2020 Exit Conference
ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that the agency failed to report to Central Intake suspected physical
abuse of a foster child by the bio-father and stepmother.
INVESTIGATION:
On June 3, 2020, a special investigation was initiated in response to the allegation
described above. The complainant, agency staff, relatives and another DHHS
Worker were interviewed. Documents were also reviewed. What follows is
information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
On June 4, 2020, the complainant was interviewed. Staff 1 offered the following
information. The biological father and stepmother of Foster Child A had informed
Staff 1, that they had been taping socks over the hands and arms of Foster Child A
to prevent her from masturbating and inserting objects into her vagina. This
information was provided to Staff 1 on February 28, 2020, during a visit to the bio-
father and stepmothers home. Staff 1 also stated that during a May 12, 2020 family
team meeting, (FTM), the stepmother again reported that Foster Child A’s hand and
arms were taped during the nighttime hours to prevent her from doing self-harm.
Staff 1 reported that the agency had failed to make a complaint to central intake
3

upon knowledge of the socks and taping on February 28, 2020 and May 12, 2020.
Staff 1 referred me to the DHHS Worker involved in the case.
On June 14, 2020, the DHHS Worker was interviewed. She offered the following
information. She reported that Staff 1 had informed her on May 14, 2020, that
during the FTM on May 12, 2020, that the bio-father and stepmother had reported
that they taped socks over the hands and arms of Foster Child A at night time to
prevent her from inserting objects into her vagina. The DHHS Worker reported that it
subsequently was discovered that the taping also involved taping the legs of Foster
Child A. The DHHS Worker reported that the bio-father and stepmother had
informed her that they told Staff 1 about the taping during the February 28, 2020 visit
and that Staff 1 did not tell them to not use tape and socks to prevent Foster Child A
from self-harm. The DHHS Worker reported that the agency had failed to file a
complaint with central intake upon knowledge of the taping on February 28, 2020
and May 12, 2020.
On August 12, 2020, the Chief Administrator was interviewed. The Chief
Administrator provided me with the phone number of Staff 1 and stated she
remembered the case and would provide me with a timeline of events.
On August 13, 2020 Staff 1 was interviewed. Staff 1 reported that the agency had
filed two complaints regarding concerns about the mental status of the bio-father and
concerns that Foster Child A was not receiving consistent mental health treatment.
Staff 1 reported that bio-father has a history of mental health problems and there
was concern that he was not following his treatment plan. Staff 1 reported that on
May 11, 2020, the agency filed a complaint with CPS which was rejected. On May
12 the agency filed a second complaint upon conferring with DHHS. Staff 1 reported
that the complaints did not involve the taping of Foster Child A. Staff 1 reported that
during the May 12, 2020 FTM that the stepmother reported taping socks over the
hands and arms of Foster Child A. Staff 1 reported that she did not think much about
this as it was a measure to prevent Foster Child A from self-harming. Staff 1 was
asked if she had knowledge of the taping during the February 28, 2020 visit to the
home. She denied that she had any knowledge of the taping at that time and only
obtained knowledge of that during the May 12, 2020 FTM.
On August 14, 2020, the agency Program Supervisor was interviewed. She reported
that during the FTM on May 12, 2020, the agency learned of the taping of the socks
to Foster Child A but stated “There was so much going on socks and tape did not
raise concerns”. The Program Supervisor acknowledged that the taping was not
explored with the bio-father or stepmother. The Program Supervisor stated that she
had no knowledge of the taping prior to the May 12, 2020, FTM. The Program
Supervisor acknowledged that a complaint to central intake was not initiated and
completed.
On August 24, 2020, the bio-father and stepmother were interviewed. The
Stepmother reported that during the February 28, 2020 in home visit from Staff 1
4

that she had told Staff 1 that they were using the socks and tape to prevent Foster
Child A from engaging in self-harm. The stepmother reported that Staff 1 had said
okay in response and did not tell them to cease using the socks and tape as a
method to prevent self-harm. The stepmother provided me with the phone number of
a Relative, who was also present at the February 28, 2020 in home meeting and
recalls her telling Staff 1 about the taping.
On August 25, 2020, the Relative was interviewed. She reported that during the
February 28, 2020 in home visit that Staff 1 had been informed of the socks and
taping and did not offer a response. The Relative reported that at no time did Staff 1
say to not use the socks and tape.
Document Review:
A timeline of events provided by the Chief Administrator was reviewed.
The file of Foster Child A was reviewed.
The file of Staff 1 and the Program Supervisor were reviewed.
Email correspondence from the Complainant and DHHS Worker was reviewed.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12214 Compliance with 1975 PA 238.
An agency shall develop a written plan and implement the
plan to assure compliance with 1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621,
and known as the child protection law.
5

ANALYSIS: The bio-father, stepmother and Relative all reported that Staff 1
was informed by the stepmother during the February 28, 2020
visit of the taping of socks to Foster Child A’s arms. The
Program Supervisor acknowledged that she was made aware of
the taping during the May 12, 2020 FTM. Though Staff 1 denied
having knowledge of the taping during the February 28, 2020
visit she did acknowledge that she knew of the taping during the
May 12, 2020 FTM as disclosed by the stepmother.
The agency failed to report suspected child abuse on February
28, 2020 and again on May 12, 2020.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED.
SIR 2019C0114016 Dated April 15, 2019
Corrective Action Plan dated May 2, 2019.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan the recommendation is for
continuance of the regular license.
August 25, 2020
________________________________________
Doug Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 4, 2020
________________________________________
Courtney Atkins Date
Area Manager
